docs.snippet: Philipp Lahm, a 26-year-old defender, has become Germany’s captain in the absence of the injured Michael Ballack and has his team in the World Cup semifinals.
docs.lead_paragraph: Philipp Lahm, a 26-year-old defender, has become Germany’s captain in the absence of the injured Michael Ballack and has his team in the World Cup semifinals.

headline.seo: Germany Is Winning With Lahm Replacing Ballack as Captain
headline.main: Germany Lost Its Captain but Gained a New Approach
headline.print_headline: Germany Lost Its Captain but Gained a New Approach

docs.snippet: A Sports of The Times column on Saturday, about Luis Suárez's saving the World Cup for Uruguay when he used his hands to block a shot, misidentified the round in which Diego Maradona's so-called Hand of God goal took place in the 1986 World Cup. It...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Sports of The Times column on Saturday, about Luis Suárez's saving the World Cup for Uruguay when he used his hands to block a shot, misidentified the round in which Diego Maradona's so-called Hand of God goal took place in the 1986 World Cup. It was during the quarterfinals, not the semifinals.

docs.snippet: The Dutch are not behaving themselves. Just look at their victory over Uruguay. If someone had told you before the World Cup that the Netherlands would enjoy a 3-2 triumph at the semifinal stage, you'd imagine a game replete with skill and thrill.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Dutch are not behaving themselves. Just look at their victory over Uruguay. If someone had told you before the World Cup that the Netherlands would enjoy a 3-2 triumph at the semifinal stage, you'd imagine a game replete with skill and thrill.
docs.abstract: The Dutch are not behaving themselves. Just look at their victory over Uruguay. If someone had told you before the World Cup that the Netherlands would enjoy a 3-2 triumph at the semifinal stage, you'd imagine a game replete with skill and thrill.

headline.main: Function Over Style? A Surprise From the Dutch

docs.snippet: In a luscious and stupendous semifinal in Durban on the Indian Ocean, Germany and Spain arrive at their Euro 2008 title-match reunion with roles few envisioned in the prehistoric days of early June 2010.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the hardened, entrenched word "underachiever" at last pried from its reputation and flung into its past, Spain systematically topped Germany on Wednesday night in Durban and went streaming into the glamorous soccer nation's first-ever World Cup final.
docs.abstract: In a luscious and stupendous semifinal in Durban on the Indian Ocean, Germany and Spain arrive at their Euro 2008 title-match reunion with roles few envisioned in the prehistoric days of early June 2010.

headline.main: World Cup Live: Germany vs. Spain

docs.snippet: In reporting on N.B.A. free agency, even a network’s own programming is confidential.
docs.lead_paragraph: In reporting on N.B.A. free agency, even a network’s own programming is confidential.

docs.snippet: After Sunday’s final, Spain or the Netherlands will take a seat at the small table of countries that have won the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: After Sunday’s final, Spain or the Netherlands will take a seat at the small table of countries that have won the World Cup.

headline.seo: Spain or Netherlands Will Join an Exclusive Club

docs.snippet: The national anthems of the seven previous FIFA world champions, and those of Sunday's contenders, Spain and the Netherlands.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday either Spain or the Netherlands will become just the eighth country to lift the World Cup, meaning a new national anthem will join the select group sung in celebration of the most longed-for sporting achievement on the planet.
docs.abstract: The national anthems of the seven previous FIFA world champions, and those of Sunday's contenders, Spain and the Netherlands.

docs.snippet: An octopus known for his soccer punditry will make his final picks of the World Cup known on Friday. A rival prognosticator, a parrot in Singapore, advises fans to bet on the Netherlands.
docs.lead_paragraph: German, Dutch and Spanish television stations are preparing to broadcast live from an aquarium in Oberhausen, Germany, on Friday, when an octopus named Paul, whose handlers claim he can predict the outcome of World Cup soccer matches, will attempt to call the last two games of the tournament.
docs.abstract: An octopus known for his soccer punditry will make his final picks of the World Cup known on Friday. A rival prognosticator, a parrot in Singapore, advises fans to bet on the Netherlands.

headline.main: As Octopus Ponders Final Choice, Parrot Tips Dutch to Take World Cup

docs.snippet: The Spanish defender has shut down opponents for years for both Spain and his club, Barcelona.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish defender has shut down opponents for years for both Spain and his club, Barcelona.

headline.seo: Puyol Is a Rock in Defense, and Spain Keeps Rolling
headline.main: Puyol, a Star on Defense, Wins It With Offense
headline.print_headline: Puyol, a Star on Defense, Wins It With Offense
